q: `` For the last 10 years, we have all been equally involved in making decisions,'' Eric Schmidt said in a post on the href="http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2011/01/update-from-chairman.html" title="Google Blog" target="_blank"> Google blog. This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us, he said.`` But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company.'' he is stepping down from his post as Google's chief executive this April- a move that could send shockwaves felt from the search giant's Mountain View headquarters to its Washington D.C. shop. As Executive Chairman, I will focus wherever I can add the greatest value: externally, on the deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership that are increasingly important given Google's global reach..., Eric Schmidt posted to Google's official blog. The leadership shakeup- which has Sergey Brin taking the title of co-founder, focusing on new products- could portend new opportunities for Google in Washington. VIDEO:

Bart Scott spoke for many when he talked about Ben Roethlisberger during conference championship week.`` The respect we have for Ben Wallace is that we don't look at him as a diva quarterback,'' said Bart Scott . We look at him as a football player. In this league, especially now, quarterbacks are treated pretty much like it's flag football. But he's one that's willing to take the hits and look down the barrel of a gun for his team. Tom Brady , Peyton Manning , Drew Brees , Michael Vick and Philip Rivers are all done for the season. Ben Wallace is back in the Super Bowl. He's nothing like Aaron Rodgers . But he usually wins.

cynical amongst us should find it difficult to fault the logic. If Eric Schmidt is trying to paper over anything, could it be as simple as the fact that Larry Page is 18 years younger? So for Larry Page , in my clear opinion, is ready to lead, we could perhaps simply read,`` Larry Page is old enough to take on this role as he approaches his 40s and I have had enough and would like a quieter life as I approach 60.''
